Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common.io

Class SwapFileOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • nl.naturalis.common.io.SwapOutputStream
        • nl.naturalis.common.io.SwapFileOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, Flushable, AutoCloseable
    public class SwapFileOutputStream
extends SwapOutputStream
    A SwapOutputStream that swaps to file once its internal buffer overflows. Example: 

       String data = "Is this going to be swapped???";
   // Create SwapFileOutputStream that swaps to a temp file if more
   // than 8 bytes are written to it
   SwapFileOutputStream sfos = SwapFileOutputStream.newInstance(8);
   sfos.write(data.getBytes());
   ByteArrayOutputStream baos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
   sfos.collect(baos);
   // Delete swap file
   sfos.cleanup();
   assertEquals(data, baos.toString());
    Author:
    Ayco Holleman
    See Also:
    SwapOutputStream

    • Constructor Detail

      • SwapFileOutputStream

        public SwapFileOutputStream​(File swapFile)
                     throws IOException
        Creates a new instance that swaps to the specified file. The size of the internal buffer will be 4 kilobytes. The BufferedOutputStream created for the swap file will have a 512-byte buffer. (In other words, the SwapFileOutputStream first fills up an internal buffer of 4 kilobytes, and then starts writing to the swap file in chunks of 512 bytes.)
        Parameters:
        swapFile - The file to write to once the internal buffer overflows
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • SwapFileOutputStream

        public SwapFileOutputStream​(File swapFile,
                            int treshold)
                     throws IOException
        Creates a new instance that swaps to the specified file. The size of the internal buffer is specified through the treshold parameter. The BufferedOutputStream created for the swap file will have a 512-byte buffer.
        Parameters:
        swapFile - The file to write to once the internal buffer overflows
        treshold - The size in bytes of the internal buffer
        Throws:
        IOException

      • SwapFileOutputStream

        public SwapFileOutputStream​(File swapFile,
                            int treshold,
                            int bufSize)
                     throws IOException
        Creates a new instance that swaps to the specified file. The size of the internal buffer is specified through the treshold parameter. The BufferedOutputStream created for the swap file will have a size of bufSize bytes.
        Parameters:
        swapFile - The file to write to once the internal buffer overflows
        treshold - The size in bytes of the internal buffer
        bufSize - The buffer size of the BufferedOutputStream used to write to the swap file and the BufferedInpuStream used to read from the swap file (in the collect method)
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs

    • Method Detail

      • newInstance

        public static SwapFileOutputStream newInstance()
                                        throws IOException
        Creates a new instance that swaps to an auto-generated temp file. The size of the internal buffer will be 4 kilobytes. The BufferedOutputStream created for the swap file will have a 512-byte buffer. (In other words, the SwapFileOutputStream first fills up an internal buffer of 4 kilobytes, and then starts writing to the swap file in chunks of 512 bytes.)
        Returns:
        A SwapFileOutputStream that swaps to an auto-generated temp file
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • newInstance

                                        throws IOException
        Creates a new instance that swaps to an auto-generated temp file. The size of the internal buffer is specified through the treshold parameter. The BufferedOutputStream created for the swap file will have a 512-byte buffer.
        Parameters:
        treshold - The size in bytes of the internal buffer
        Returns:
        A SwapFileOutputStream that swaps to an auto-generated temp file
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs
